text: Psalm 135
Praise to God for His Power and Redemption
Praise Yah!\f + \fr 135:1 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f* Praise the name of Yahweh.
Praise \add him\add*, O servants of Yahweh,
who stand in the house\f + \fr 135:2 \ft Or “temple” \f* of Yahweh,
in the courts of the house\f + \fr 135:2 \ft Or “temple” \f* of our God.
Praise Yah,\f + \fr 135:3 \ft A shortened form of “Yahweh” \f* for Yahweh \add is\add* good.
Sing praises concerning his name, for \add it is\add* pleasant.
For Yah has chosen Jacob for himself,
Israel as his special possession.
For I know that Yahweh \add is\add* great,
and our Lord \add is greater\add* than all gods.
All that Yahweh desires, he does,
in heaven and on earth,
in the seas and all \add the\add* depths.
\add He\add* causes clouds to rise from the edge of the earth;
he makes lightnings for the rain;
\add he\add* brings out \add the\add* wind from his storehouses.
Who struck the firstborn of Egypt,
both of humans\f + \fr 135:8 \ft Hebrew “human” \f* and animals.\f + \fr 135:8 \ft Hebrew “animal” \f*
He sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt,
against Pharaoh and all his servants.
Who struck many nations
and killed mighty kings—
Sihon the king of the Amorites,
and Og the king of Bashan,
and all the kingdoms of Canaan—
and he gave their land as an inheritance,
an inheritance for his people Israel.
O Yahweh, your name \add endures\add* forever,
your ⸤renown⸥\f + \fr 135:13 \ft Literally “remembrance” \f* ⸤throughout all generations⸥,\f + \fr 135:13 \ft Literally “for a generation and a generation” \f*
for Yahweh will plead \add the\add* cause \add of\add* his people
and will have compassion on his servants.
The idols of the nations \add are\add* silver and gold,
\add the\add* work of the hands of humankind.
They have mouths, but cannot speak;
they have eyes, but cannot see;
they have ears, but cannot hear;
there is not even breath in their mouths.
\add Those who\add* make them become like them,
\add as does\add* everyone who trusts in them.
O house of Israel, bless Yahweh.
O house of Aaron, bless Yahweh.
O house of Levi, bless Yahweh.
\add You who\add* fear Yahweh, bless Yahweh.
Blessed \add be\add* Yahweh from Zion,
who dwells \add in\add* Jerusalem. Praise Yah!\f + \fr 135:21 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
